Class Mech

  • java.lang.Object

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Damageable, Movable, Originator, Unit
    public class Mech
extends AbstractUnit

    • Constructor Detail

      • Mech

        public Mech​(String type,
            char id,
            Hex hex,
            Direction facing,
            MovementFactory movementFactory,
            RealComponent head,
            RealComponent centerTorso,
            RealComponent rightTorso,
            RealComponent leftTorso,
            RealComponent rightArm,
            RealComponent leftArm,
            RealComponent rightLeg,
            RealComponent leftLeg)
        Construct a new mech.
        Parameters:
        type - type of unit
        id - identification of unit, should be unique to each unit
        hex - starting hex coordinate
        facing - initial facing direction
        movementFactory - factory to use to construct movement strategies
        head - head component
        centerTorso - center torso component
        rightTorso - right torso component
        leftTorso - left torso component
        rightArm - right arm component
        leftArm - left arm component
        rightLeg - right leg component
        leftLeg - left leg component

      • isDestroyed

        public boolean isDestroyed()
        Determine if the mech is destroyed. If the head or the center torso is destroyed the entire mech is destroyed.
        Returns:
        true if the mech is destroyed, false otherwise

      • getComponents

        Get a list of components in the unit.
        Returns:
        list of unit components

      • applyDamage

        public List<DamageRecord> applyDamage​(Weapon weapon,
                                      int damage)
        Apply damage to mech, propagating to other components when one is destroyed. If either leg is destroyed then mobility is destroyed.
        Parameters:
        weapon - the weapon that is doing the damage
        damage - amount of damage to apply
        Returns:
        list of damage records
        See Also:
        DamageRecord
